poem:
Title: "Ode to Movement"

Temples of veins beckon the rouge of their flow,
In a ballet invisible to the slothful eye.
Through the parlor of health, where languor's foe,
Trades slumbers' chains for the open sky.
A ticking silence encased in wayward bone,
A proclamation for future, etched in the now unknown.
Move, dear heart, before you turn to stone.
